trans-unit.source: Setting up a DSC pull client
trans-unit.target: Setting up a DSC pull client

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: Each target node has to be told to use pull mode and given the URL where it can contact the pull server to get configurations.
trans-unit.target: Each target node has to be told to use pull mode and given the URL where it can contact the pull server to get configurations.

trans-unit.source: The following topics explain how to set up pull clients:
trans-unit.target: The following topics explain how to set up pull clients:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration names</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration names</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration ID</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration ID</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To set up a pull client in PowerShell 4.0, see <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration ID in PowerShell 4.0</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To set up a pull client in PowerShell 4.0, see <link><linkText>Setting up a pull client using configuration ID in PowerShell 4.0</linkText><title></title></link>.
